#Text=Interview
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) )
#Text=Can you describe a little bit about yourself and your background , and how you came to be interested in Scientology ?
#Text=Nancy Many :
#Text=I was a college student , just starting out in the early 70 ’s .
#Text=It was a time of turmoil , Civil Rights , Women ’s Rights , The deaths of JFK , MLK and Bobby Kennedy were still close to our time period .
#Text=Viet Nam was polarizing the nation and dividing families .
#Text=Woodstock had happened a few years before .
#Text=The culture held no real anchors – it seemed everyone was experimenting .
#Text=The progam to become a counselor at my college was losing it ’s funding , I had just broken up with a long term boyfriend , and every one I knew was either into drugs or Alcohol .
#Text=Never big on alcohol I was growing tired of the drugs .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) When you first started getting involved in Scientology , what attracted you to it ?
#Text=NM :
#Text=That they were going to make the world a better place , that they did not do drugs and lived a communal lifestyle .
#Text=Aida Thomas talks with Nancy Many in a separate interview ( October 2009 ) Image : Aida Thomas .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) What positive aspects did you gain from your experiences in Scientology ? What benefits does Scientology have to offer people who take its courses ?
#Text=NM :
#Text=I gained more self confidence , I gained an ability to work in sales .
#Text=In the first course I gained the ability to quiet my mind and to just exist in the universe .
#Text=I think these same benefits are there today for new people , but do I think they are worth the Price Charged , or Years of one ’s life given -- - No I do not .
#Text=Last I checked to do all of Scientology , and make it to the top of the bridge – Operating Thetan 8 , it would cost approximately $ 250,000 .
#Text=In the old days you could sign a contract for up to a Billion Years and get those services at no cost , but to my knowledge that is not the type of counseling staff are getting now .

#Text=And if you did leave before your particular contract was over , you will receive what is called a “ FreeLoader Bill ” , a total of all the services that you received in exchange for your working for them .
#Text=The current and past food and pay situation for staff members is below the illegal workers in this country .

#Text=( ( WN ) ) If you desired something that Scientology offered - and felt you gain positively from some of your experiences while inside the organization - have you sought out and found such values elsewhere , for example , spirituality or another form of a religious belief system ?
#Text=NM : After I left Scientology I did make a list of all the courses , things I learned , personal abilities I had and what I liked from it .
#Text=Over the years I have been able to find much of what I liked in other philosophies written years ago by different authors .

#Text=L. Ron Hubbard originally acknowledged all those learned men in the beginning of the book Science of Survival , but over the years that list has dwindled , until now it seems that L. Ron Hubbard invented all this material .

#Text=What I will give him credit for is that he put it in simple , modern day English , so it was easier to grasp , but of my list of things I have found useful , I was able to find them elsewhere , and for a much less expensive price .
